ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
python_min:
- '3.10'
target_platform:
- linux-64
vtk:
- 9.5.1
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version

about.summary: Cross platform, open source application for the processing, visualization, and analysis of 3D tomography data
Cross platform, open source application for the processing, visualization, and analysis of 3D tomography data

about.description:
This package provides the Python pipeline execution tools from the Tomviz
project, enabling command-line execution of tomviz operators and pipelines
without the full GUI application. It includes the tomviz Python library and
the tomviz-pipeline command-line tool for processing tomographic data.

This package is also required when using the Tomviz Desktop application's
ExternalPython execution mode, where pipelines run in a separate conda
environment from the main application. The package must be installed
in that separate conda environment.
about.summary: Python pipeline execution tools for tomviz
Cross platform, open source application for the processing, visualization, and analysis of 3D tomography data

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "tomviz" %}
{% set version = "2.2.3" %}
{% set paraview_version = "6.0.1" %}
{% set python_min = "3.10" %}
{% set build_number = "0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}-split
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  - git_url: https://github.com/OpenChemistry/tomviz
    git_rev: {{ version }}
    folder: tomviz
  # Submodules updated in build.sh: pybind11

build:
  number: {{ build_number }}

outputs:
  # First output: main tomviz desktop application
  - name: tomviz
    script: build_tomviz.sh   # [unix]
    script: build_tomviz.bat  # [win]
    build:
      number: {{ build_number }}
      # Skip Python3.14 until ParaView has packages for it
      # Windows is also not working right now...
      skip: true  # [py == 314 or win]
    requirements:
      build:
        - {{ compiler('c') }}
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - {{ stdlib('c') }}
        - cmake
        - ninja
        - git
      host:
        - python
        - paraview =={{ paraview_version }}
        - vtk
        - libxml2-devel 2.14*
      run:
        - python
        - numpy
        - scipy
        - h5py
        - click
        - tqdm
        - marshmallow
        - jsonpatch
        - jsonpointer
        - pyfftw
        - pygments
    test:
      imports:
        - paraview
        - paraview.simple
        - paraview.numpy_support
        - tomviz
        - tomviz.cli
    about:
      home: https://github.com/OpenChemistry/tomviz
      license: BSD-3-Clause
      license_family: BSD
      license_file:
        - tomviz/LICENSE
      summary: 'Cross platform, open source application for the processing, visualization, and analysis of 3D tomography data'
      doc_url: https://tomviz.readthedocs.io/
      dev_url: https://github.com/OpenChemistry/tomviz

  # Second output: tomviz-pipeline Python package
  - name: tomviz-pipeline
    script: build_tomviz-pipeline.sh   # [unix]
    script: build_tomviz-pipeline.bat  # [win]
    build:
      number: {{ build_number }}
      noarch: python
      skip: true  # [not linux or py != 310]  # Only build once on py310 for Linux
      entry_points:
        - tomviz-pipeline = tomviz.cli:main
    requirements:
      host:
        - python {{ python_min }}
        - pip
        - setuptools
      run:
        - python >={{ python_min }}
        - numpy
        - scipy
        - h5py
        - click
        - tqdm
        - marshmallow
        - jsonpatch
        - jsonpointer
        - pyfftw
    test:
      imports:
        - tomviz
        - tomviz.cli
        - tomviz.operators
      commands:
        - tomviz-pipeline --help
        - python -c "import tomviz; print('tomviz imported successfully')"
      requires:
        - python {{ python_min }}
        - pip
    about:
      home: https://github.com/OpenChemistry/tomviz
      license: BSD-3-Clause
      license_family: BSD
      license_file:
        - tomviz/LICENSE
      summary: 'Python pipeline execution tools for tomviz'
      description: |
        This package provides the Python pipeline execution tools from the Tomviz
        project, enabling command-line execution of tomviz operators and pipelines
        without the full GUI application. It includes the tomviz Python library and
        the tomviz-pipeline command-line tool for processing tomographic data.

        This package is also required when using the Tomviz Desktop application's
        ExternalPython execution mode, where pipelines run in a separate conda
        environment from the main application. The package must be installed
        in that separate conda environment.
      doc_url: https://tomviz.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pipelines.html
      dev_url: https://github.com/OpenChemistry/tomviz

# This extra "about" section is a requirement by conda-forge, even
# though it's not actually used.
about:
  home: https://github.com/OpenChemistry/tomviz
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file:
    - tomviz/LICENSE
  summary: 'Cross platform, open source application for the processing, visualization, and analysis of 3D tomography data'
  doc_url: https://tomviz.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/OpenChemistry/tomviz

extra:
  feedstock-name: tomviz
  recipe-maintainers:
    - cjh1
    - psavery
    - conda-forge/event-model
